page.title: 06WANBOROUGH MANOR
page.content:
There has been a{Manor at Wanborough since Saxon times but it has not often been lived in by the Lords of the Manor. At the end of the{19th Century it was let to Sir Algernon and Lady Mary West. He was private secretary to Gladstone, who visited the Manor during Sir Algernon's tenancy, as did {Queen Victoria}and Asquith.
During World War I the house was used as a{military hospital}and it was then that during renovations two priest's holes were discovered. There is reputed to be a ghost.
The house was let to the{S.O.E. during World War II and was used for the training of agents who were to be parachuted into enemy held territory, where they worked with the resistance movements.
